clinical_study.brief_title: Longitudinal Changes in Refractive Error After Primary IOL Implantation Among Children With Congenital Cataract
clinical_study.official_title: Longitudinal Changes in Refractive Error After Primary IOL Implantation Among Children With Unilateral and Bilateral Congenital Cataract

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of prospective cohort study is to estimate the rate of change in postoperative change after primary IOL implantation among children with congenital cataract(CC) and to explore key factors associated with the rate of change.

detailed_description.textblock: Due to myopic shift, it's difficult to select power of IOL implanted in eye with congenital cataract. The developmental profile of refraction among patient with congenital catarat is has not yet been fully characterized. The investigator recruited a large cohort of Chinese CC children.After primary IOL implatation, routine examinations including retinoscopy were completed. Data were analysed to to estimate the rate of change in postoperative change after primary IOL implantation among children with congenital cataract and to explore key factors associated with the rate of change.

primary_outcome.measure: The refraction status (presented as spherical equivalent, SE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to three years after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Refractions were conducted with objective retinoscopy after cycloplegia, and performed by experienced optometrists.

intervention.description: implant IOL in capsular bag after cataract extraction

study_pop.textblock: CC patients underwent surgery of cataratc extraction and primary intraocular lens (IOL) implantation at the Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center between 2010 and 2016 were recruited.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children with uncomplicated surgeries
- Children with unilateral/bilateral cataract
Exclusion Criteria:
- Corneal diseases
- Lens luxation
- Glaucoma
- Retinal diseases
- Nystagmus and nanophthalmos

facility.name: Zhognshan Ophthalmic Center, Sun Yat-sen University
